name: Endb
classdesc: Simple key-value storage with support for multiple backends.

params.description: The options for Endb.
params.name: options

comment:
/**
	 * Gets all the elements from the database.
	 * @return {Promise<any[]>} All the elements in the database.
	 */
description: Gets all the elements from the database.

returns.description: All the elements in the database.

name: all

comment:
/**
	 * Clears all elements from the database.
	 * @return {Promise<undefined>} Returns `undefined`.
	 */
description: Clears all elements from the database.
name: clear

comment:
/**
	 * Deletes an element from the database by key.
	 * @param {string|string[]} key The key(s) of the element to remove from the database.
	 * @return {Promise<boolean>} `true` if the element is deleted successfully, otherwise `false`.
	 * @example
	 * await Endb.set('foo', 'bar'); // true
	 *
	 * await Endb.delete('foo'); // true
	 */
description: Deletes an element from the database by key.

params.description: The key(s) of the element to remove from the database.
params.name: key

returns.description: `true` if the element is deleted successfully, otherwise `false`.

examples:
await Endb.set('foo', 'bar'); // true

await Endb.delete('foo'); // true
name: delete

comment:
/**
	 * Ensures if an element exists in the database. If the element does not exist, sets the element to the database and returns the value.
	 * @param {string} key The key of the element to ensure.
	 * @param {*} value The value of the element to ensure.
	 * @param {?string} [path]
	 * @return {Promise<any|undefined>} The (default) value of the element.
	 * @example
	 * await Endb.set('en', 'db');
	 *
	 * const data = await Endb.ensure('foo', 'bar');
	 * console.log(data); // 'bar'
	 *
	 * const data = await Endb.ensure('en', 'db');
	 * console.log(data); // 'db'
	 */
description: Ensures if an element exists in the database. If the element does not exist, sets the element to the database and returns the value.

params.description: The key of the element to ensure.
params.name: key

params.description: The value of the element to ensure.
params.name: value

name: ensure

comment:
/**
	 * Finds a single item where the given function returns a truthy value.
	 * Behaves like {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find Array.prototype.find}.
	 * The database elements is mapped by their `key`. If you want to find an element by key, you should use the `get` method instead.
	 * See {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/get MDN} for more details.
	 * @param {Function} fn The function to execute on each value in the element.
	 * @param {*} [thisArg] Object to use as `this` inside callback.
	 * @return {Promise<*|undefined>} The first element in the database that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise `undefined` is returned
	 * @example
	 * await Endb.set('foo', 'bar');
	 * await Endb.set('profile', {
	 *   id: 1234567890,
	 *   username: 'user',
	 *   verified: true,
	 *   nil: null,
	 *   hobbies: ['programming']
	 * });
	 *
	 * await Endb.find(v => v === 'bar'); // { key: 'foo', value: 'bar' }
	 * await Endb.find(v => v.verified === true); // { key: 'profile', value: { ... } }
	 * await Endb.find(v => v.desc === 'desc'); // undefined
	 */
description:
Finds a single item where the given function returns a truthy value.
Behaves like {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/find Array.prototype.find}.
The database elements is mapped by their `key`. If you want to find an element by key, you should use the `get` method instead.
See {@link https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Map/get MDN} for more details.

params.description: The function to execute on each value in the element.
params.name: fn

params.description: Object to use as `this` inside callback.
params.name: thisArg

returns.description: The first element in the database that satisfies the provided testing function. Otherwise `undefined` is returned

name: find

comment:
/**
	 * Gets the value of an element from the database by key.
	 * @param {string} key The key of the element to get.
	 * @param {?string} [path] The path of the property to get from the value.
	 * @return {Promise<*|undefined>} The value of the element, or `undefined` if the element cannot be found in the database.
	 * @example
	 * const data = await Endb.get('foo');
	 * console.log(data); // 'bar'
	 *
	 * // Using path feature
	 * await Endb.get('profile', 'verified'); // false
	 */
description: Gets the value of an element from the database by key.

params.description: The key of the element to get.
params.name: key

params.description: The path of the property to get from the value.
params.name: path

returns.description: The value of the element, or `undefined` if the element cannot be found in the database.

name: get

comment:
/**
	 * Checks whether an element exists in the database or not.
	 * @param {string} key The key of an element to check for.
	 * @param {?string} [path] The path of the property to check.
	 * @return {Promise<boolean>} `true` if the element exists in the database, otherwise `false`.
	 */
description: Checks whether an element exists in the database or not.

params.description: The key of an element to check for.
params.name: key

params.description: The path of the property to check.
params.name: path

returns.description: `true` if the element exists in the database, otherwise `false`.

name: has

comment:
/**
	 * Returns an array that contains the keys of each element.
	 * @return {Promise<string[]>} An array that contains the keys of each element.
	 */
description: Returns an array that contains the keys of each element.

returns.description: An array that contains the keys of each element.

name: keys

comment:
/**
	 * Performs a mathematical operation on a value of an element.
	 * @param {string} key The key of the element.
	 * @param {string} operation The mathematical operation to perform.
	 * @param {number} operand The right-hand operand.
	 * @param {?string} [path] The path of the property to perform mathematical operation on.
	 * @return {true} Returns `true`.
	 * @example
	 * balance.set('endb', 100);
	 *
	 * balance.math('endb', 'add', 100); // true
	 */
description: Performs a mathematical operation on a value of an element.

params.description: The key of the element.
params.name: key

params.description: The mathematical operation to perform.
params.name: operation

params.description: The right-hand operand.
params.name: operand

params.description: The path of the property to perform mathematical operation on.
params.name: path

name: math

params.description: An array of strings. Each element will create new instance.
params.name: names

params.description: The options for the instances.
params.name: options

returns.description: An object containing created Endb instances.

name: multi

description: The options the database was instantiated with.
name: options

comment:
/**
	 * Pushes an item to the array value in the database.
	 * @param {string} key The key of the element to push to.
	 * @param {*} value The value to push.
	 * @param {?string} [path] The path of the property of the value to push.
	 * @param {boolean} [allowDuplicates=false] Whether or not, allow duplicates elements in the value.
	 * @return {Promise<*>} The value to push.
	 */
description: Pushes an item to the array value in the database.

params.description: The key of the element to push to.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to push.
params.name: value

params.description: The path of the property of the value to push.
params.name: path

params.description: Whether or not, allow duplicates elements in the value.
params.name: allowDuplicates

name: push

comment:
/**
	 * Removes an item from the array value of an element in the database.
	 * Note: structured or complex data types such as arrays or objects cannot be removed from the value of the element.
	 * @param {string} key The key of the element to remove.
	 * @param {*} value The value to remove. Must be a string.
	 * @param {?string} [path] The path of the property to remove.
	 * @return {Promise<*>} The value to remove.
	 */
description:
Removes an item from the array value of an element in the database.
Note: structured or complex data types such as arrays or objects cannot be removed from the value of the element.

params.description: The key of the element to remove.
params.name: key

params.description: The value to remove. Must be a string.
params.name: value

params.description: The path of the property to remove.
params.name: path

params.description: The value of the element to set to the database.
params.name: value

params.description: The path of the property to set in the value.
params.name: path

	 * Returns an array that contains the values of each element.
	 * @return {Promise<any[]>} Array that contains the values of each element.
	 */

returns.description: Array that contains the values of each element.

name: values

comment:
/**
	 * The options for Endb.
	 * @typedef {Object} EndbOptions
	 * @property {string} [uri] The connection URI of the database.
	 * @property {string} [namespace='endb'] The namespace of the database.
	 * @property {string} [adapter] The storage adapter or backend to use.
	 * @property {*} [store=Map]
	 * @property {Function} [serialize=Util.stringify] A data serialization function.
	 * @property {Function} [deserialize=Util.parse] A data deserialization function.
	 * @property {string} [collection='endb'] The name of the collection. Only works for MongoDB.
	 * @property {string} [table='endb'] The name of the table. Only works for SQL databases.
	 * @property {number} [keySize=255] The maximum size of the keys of elements.
	 */
name: EndbOptions

properties.description: The connection URI of the database.
properties.name: uri

properties.description: The storage adapter or backend to use.
properties.name: adapter

properties.description: The name of the collection. Only works for MongoDB.
properties.name: collection

properties.description: The name of the table. Only works for SQL databases.
properties.name: table

properties.description: The maximum size of the keys of elements.
properties.name: keySize
